pullrequest.title: fix build on homebrew with ffmpeg4

content.raw:
I just tried running [worlds/openal.world](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/e08439ebc7eaa6ac48e358ee7a63537f5be15a2d/worlds/openal.world?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) using the gazebo9 brew bottle, and I hear static for cheer.mp3 and cheer.ogg, though cheer.wav works fine. I don't have a Linux machine here to test with. Can someone with a Linux machine try this to confirm this is still working with the older version of ffmpeg?

We could update the test expectation, but if the functionality doesn't work, it seems a little pointless. I would just disable the test and open an issue saying that the AudioDecoder is broken.
content.html:
I just tried running worlds/openal.world using the gazebo9 brew bottle, and I hear static for cheer.mp3 and cheer.ogg, though cheer.wav works fine. I don't have a Linux machine here to test with. Can someone with a Linux machine try this to confirm this is still working with the older version of ffmpeg?

We could update the test expectation, but if the functionality doesn't work, it seems a little pointless. I would just disable the test and open an issue saying that the AudioDecoder is broken.
